lead_paragraph: The Blue Jays omitted Frank Thomas’s name and .167 average from the middle of their order on Saturday. Thomas, below, who turns 40 next month, has not homered in 35 at-bats, and 4 of his 11 R.B.I. came on a grand slam. Matt Stairs, who is hitting .308, replaced Thomas as the designated hitter Saturday and went 2 for 3. Scott Rolen could return from the disabled list in two weeks. Keep in mind, if Thomas gets 376 plate appearances, his $10 million option for 2009 is guaranteed.
